page.title: 01FARMING
page.content: Most farms in the Ruabon area are 'mixed farms'.Farmers keep cows,sheep and grow crops. Many farmers keep cows for their milk or rear them for fattening or both.The cows are milked twice a day.A Milk Marketing Board tanker takes the milk to the creamery in Marchwiel.In winter cows are kept in cubicles and are fed on hay,meal and 'big bale silage'.Bullocks are sometimes reared for fattening. Some farmers keep sheep with about 90 in a flock.Young rams called 'tups' are sold for meat.The ewes are kept for wool and breeding. Farmer plough some fields and grow hay,kale and barley for winter feed.Potatoes are sometimes grown for sale to the public.Markets are Wrexham,Oswestry,Welshpool and Beeston.
